summary: HSV-1 is a double-stranded DNA virus of the herpesviridae family. it can infect the oral mucosa, eyes, nasal mucosa, oropharynx and nervous system. it may cause severe complications including blindness, atypical pneumonia, aseptic meningitis, encephalitis, and even death. ICP0, ICP4, ICP22, ICP27, and ICP47 are first transcribed and responsible for early (E) and late (L) viral gene expressions after viral entry.
